alert.note: Alert for Pike (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 4:21PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Pike County through 445 PM CDT... At 421 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Banks, or near Troy. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Troy, Brundidge, Banks, Troy Municipal Airport, Antioch, Troy University, Sandfield, Brundidge Municipal Airport, Monticello, Mossy Grove and Josie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
